WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Hi, 

TypeScript will be more readable if declared type names are colorised. I've attached a comparison with another popular language.

Thanks.

Comments.Message: Assigning to Jonathan who is managing our suggestions.

Any information on when this is going to be implemented? This is a pretty old issue already and is still on proposed. I don't think implementing this feature is a very big challenge. When implemented it is also a great Visual increase because you can quickly separate classes/interfaces from properties/functions/variables.
Doing this would greatly increase adoption and confidence in TypeScript in my opinion. It's not just about readability, but about perception. When you look at C# color-coding, it just _feels_ solid.
